thread.title: Google celebrates NASA's new exoplanet discovery with delightful doodle! | Zee News
thread.title_full: Google celebrates NASA's new exoplanet discovery with delightful doodle! | Zee News

title: Google celebrates NASA's new exoplanet discovery with delightful doodle! | Zee News
text:
Google celebrates NASA's new exoplanet discovery with delightful doodle! By Zee Media Bureau | Last Updated: Thursday, February 23, 2017 - 08:42 0 Follow @ZeeNews 
New Delhi: NASA's discovery of what seems like a whole new 'solar system' on Wednesday has the world's space enthusiasts in a tizzy. 
The seven Earth-like planets orbiting a small star in a far away galaxy has turned out to be one of the most promising hunting grounds so far for life beyond our solar system. 
According to NASA, the discovery sets a new record for greatest number of habitable-zone planets found around a single star outside our solar system. 
NASA discovers seven Earth-like planets orbiting around a single star 
Well, looks like Google couldn't hide its excitement on the news either, since it immediately came out with an interactive exoplanet doodle! 
The rare late-day, special doodle shows planet Earth looking through NASA's Spitzer Space Telescope and spotting the star and the seven Earth-like planets. 
The doodle is so delightful that NASA couldn't help but tweet it too! Check it out: Notice the new @GoogleDoodles ? It's about the 7 Earth-sized planets we discovered around nearby star! Get the news: https://t.co/G9tW3cJMnV pic.twitter.com/dOHB0bLqXn First Published: Thursday, February 23, 2017 - 08:25 More from zeenews
